author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: What does 'Execution block structure cleanup' entail?

author: sky.cactus
content: There are some things that are in the block header but are no longer used, and the various merkle trees may benefit from being switched to a different data structure.

author: sky.cactus
content: For example, after The Merge mixhash is a header field that is always set to 0.

author: yperbasis
content: (Nitpicking) No, mixHash will be repurposed for RANDOM per EIP-4399

author: pmcgoohan
content: Hi. I'm running an EF funded project looking at tx arrival vs inclusion times in Ethereum.

author: pmcgoohan
content: I've got some interesting early data- eth p2p performance is way better than I was expecting ðŸ™‚

author: pmcgoohan
content: I'm running 3 globally distributed nodes (US, EU, AS)

author: pmcgoohan
content: Blocks arrive at each node with an avg stdev of 0.37 secs, and 99% have a max stdev of 1.88 secs

author: pmcgoohan
content: *But*

author: pmcgoohan
content: Txs arrive at each node with an avg stdev of 31 secs, and 99% have a max of 626 secs (eeeeek).

author: pmcgoohan
content: There is clearly something funky going on here

author: pmcgoohan
content: Two possible interpretations:

author: pmcgoohan
content: 1) (not my opinion) tx censorship/eclipse attacks are rife

author: pmcgoohan
content: 2) (my opinion) it's to do with the logic of when txs are queued vs pending (The p2p logic looks very similar for blocks and txs, other than in this regard).

author: pmcgoohan
content: Perhaps GPA battles adding and cancelling txs at speed are causing this?

author: pmcgoohan
content: Anyone have any ideas, or an idea of who would be good to ask?

author: pmcgoohan
content: Data https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ER0YnN0kMjuVZTCCk6ZYzORZpmctXNnF/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=104869791896672132521&rtpof=true&sd=true

author: potuz
content: Are you excluding tx above 3 sigma in your computation of the standard deviation?

author: potuz
content: it seems to me you have some clear outliers

author: pmcgoohan
content: I will exclude them down the line, but I want to understand what is causing the outliers before I do so in case it is significant.

author: Deleted User
content: the blocks are part of the consensus rules so its like a machine. of course they will propagate fast ðŸ™‚ mempool policies are different from implementation to implementation afaik which could expain the variance in tx propagation
